programmes.show_description: (1987) Sci-fi thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. A US commando unit gets trapped in the jungle by a murderous, seemingly invincible alien hunter. But they ain't got time to bleed.
Gordon Returns 1: Gordon revisits three restaurants - Handlebar, Casa Roma and The Black Pearl - to check in with the owners he helped. Has his advice been put to good use?
In Cornwall, artistic Zaya and Damian serve a modern British menu, property developers Kelly and Jon show off their refurbished mansion, and Emma and Gavin host a fun-filled Cornish night.
Some extra brunch as Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer host the food and chat show.
Tales from the Public Domain: Homer reads classic tales from an overdue library book, with himself as Odysseus at the Battle of Troy, Lisa as Joan of Arc, and Bart as Hamlet.
Homer the Moe: Moe reopens his bar as a slick members' club. So Homer opens a 'hunting club' in his garage with R.E.M. playing live (guest starring as themselves).
The Blunder Years: A hypnotist reawakens repressed memories from Homer's childhood. But what was the event that scared him so badly when he was 12? Guest starring Paul Newman.
The Parent Rap: Bart and Homer are tethered together by a strict judge after Bart and Milhouse are accused of stealing Chief Wiggum's police car.
Frying Game: Homer and Marge are framed for murder and face the electric chair. Guest starring Carmen Electra as herself.
Strike Out: Carrie suggests that Arthur should spend the day with Doug and Deacon to cheer them up while they're on strike. But it doesn't turn out as she'd hoped...
Dark Meet: Carrie and Doug reminisce about their first Thanksgiving together, when Doug first met Arthur and his wife Lily.
Twisted Sitters: Doug and Carrie babysit Deacon and Kelly's son Kirby, but he catches them in a compromising position on his parents' bed...
What Good Are You?: Ray tries to prove his 'manliness' after failing to act swiftly enough in an emergency involving Debra.
Super Bowl: Ray's sent by his paper to cover the Super Bowl, but his excitement's tempered by having to choose someone to accompany him. Will he make the right choice?
Ray's Journal: Ray's horrified to learn that his mother used to read his diary, which contained his most personal - and perverted - thoughts.
The Adventures of Bad Boy and Dirty Girl: It's the morning after, and Kate and Frasier are worried about the consequences of their fling.
The Last Time I Saw Maris: Niles decides to stand up to Maris. So she decides to divorce him.
Frasier Grinch: Frasier's excited that his son Frederick is coming for Christmas, but Martin thinks a proper Christmas should mean more than just educational presents.
Matt Forde chats about his UK tour. Yinka and Kola Bokkini discuss their YouTube show. And there's chat with Aston Merrygold and Elizabeth Dulau and music from Leigh-Anne Pinnock.
Papa's Got a Brand New Badge: Homer, Lenny and Carl start a security firm and are given the contract to look after the town when Mayor Quimby realises how inept Chief Wiggum is.
Hunka Hunka Burns in Love: Homer gets a job writing fortune cookie messages, one of which tells Mr Burns he will find love.
Treehouse of Horror XII: Homer annoys a fortune teller, who places curses on each of the Simpsons. He captures a leprechaun to break the curse, but all does not go to plan.
George visits a Moroccan oasis in the Cotswolds and seeks inspiration for his secret garden studio flat. And Chitty Chitty Bang Bang gets an extension on the Isle of Wight.
Channel 4's flagship news programme. Including the weather.
Women's FA Cup: It's derby day as Jill Scott and Maisie Adam present live coverage of the fifth round. Will this be a sweet day for the Toffees or will Liverpool have them seeing red?
Can a fox-red Labrador called Bear impress two would-be owners without putting his paw in it? And 88-year-old identical twins hope that pint-sized Alfie will join them at the pub.

programmes.show_name: New: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programmes.show_description: The potters make body part pots and sculptures of their bodies in motion, fired in brick kilns that they're building themselves. Who can carve out a place in the semi-final?
The final twelve solve a complex maths game to escape from a maze. Then the top eight compete against each other in a mind-bending memory game, for a place in the final four. (Ep5/6)
On the show this time, The Masked Singer, Love Is Blind, Gladiators, Steal, Bargain Holiday Secrets, The Floor and ITV News (Larry the Cat).
(2022) Poignant road-trip comedy with Channing Tatum. A soldier with PTSD must escort a traumatised army canine to a comrade's funeral. Can man and dog save each other's lives?
...Present: Hindman's BIFA-winning, BAFTA-nominated short film is a propulsive journey through the world of a British Pakistani takeaway as tensions rise with the heat of the stove.
Gordon Returns 2: Gordon Ramsay revisits two restaurants - Giuseppi's and Sante La Brea - to find out whether his advice has been put to good use.
Papa's Got a Brand New Badge: Homer, Lenny and Carl start a security firm and are given the contract to look after the town when Mayor Quimby realises how inept Chief Wiggum is.
The story of one of Britain's most successful and controversial prime ministers, following Blair's meteoric rise to Labour leader and prime minister with a landslide in 1997. (Ep1/3)
Hunka Hunka Burns in Love: Homer gets a job writing fortune cookie messages, one of which tells Mr Burns he will find love.
Treehouse of Horror XII: Homer annoys a fortune teller, who places curses on each of the Simpsons. He captures a leprechaun to break the curse, but all does not go to plan.
Some extra brunch as Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer host the food and chat show.
Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two sets of family home-hunters: Ian in the seaside town of Broadstairs, Kent, and newly-engaged couple Tara and Alastair in Edinburgh.
Another chance to catch Friday's new episode, with Chris Packham in Dictionary Corner. Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host.
Woody Interruptus: Kelly returns from Europe with a French boyfriend in tow, causing consternation for Woody. Cliff aims to cheat death by having his head cryogenically frozen.
Honor Thy Mother: Rebecca and Sam worry about freeloaders when Cheers is featured in an entertainment coupon book. Carla's mother makes an unreasonable demand.
Achilles Hill: Carla tells everyone that the football table is possessed. Sam raises the stakes in his feud with restaurant owner John Hill by trying to date his daughter.
Silent Partners: After spending a Valentine's dinner without talking to each other, Ray and Debra agree to take an interest in each other's hobbies.
Fairies: Ray isn't happy about the twins' roles in the school play.
Stefania Arrives: Robert gets a surprise visit from Stefania, who he fell for in Rome, and her dad. Will the holiday romance continue?
It's Hard to Say Goodbye If You Won't Leave: Frasier realises that he has strong feelings for Kate, just as she announces that she's moving to Chicago...
The Friend: Frasier realises that he hasn't made any friends since moving to Seattle, so he sets out to meet someone new.
Come Lie with Me: When Joe stays overnight with Daphne, Frasier is shocked and Niles is... well, you can imagine.
Moon Dance: When Niles decides that it's time to start dating again, he takes Daphne to a posh society ball. But has she got the wrong idea about his intentions?
The More You No: Mike, Frank, Danielle and Robbie continue to double down in Virginia but hit a roadblock with a seller who won't let go of a one-of-a-kind find.
Channel 4's midday news summary.
Rover SD1: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw travel back in time with a 1986 Rover SD1, which belongs to 58-year-old landscape gardener Darren, whose ill health has taken its toll.

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: In Gloucestershire, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet farmer Ken. In his barns, Henry finds a rare pre-WWII exercise bike and farmyard potato scales.
Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with Kelvin Fletcher in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers.
Angela and Simon dream of owning a farmhouse in France's Poitou-Charentes region, where they can indulge in art and yoga. Lucy Alexander shows them what £225k can buy.

programmes.show_name: A New Life in the Sun
programmes.show_description: In Portugal, Stretch and Rachael get to work on a run-down property. David and Lane open a French antiques emporium. Rachel joins forces with her brother at his ranch in Spain.
The ultimate B&B battle is back. Paul hosts the week's first visit at his seafront B&B in Swansea, where he's hoping stunning views and a watercolour masterclass will sail him to victory.
Knives, forks and small talk... the culinary contest is back! On night one in Bradford, Kulvir fuses Punjabi food with British classics. But could a dessert downfall scupper supper? (Ep1/5)

programmes.show_name: New: A Place in the Sun
programmes.show_description: Marcia wants a holiday home in the Gran Alacant area of Spain's Costa Blanca for her £110k. Will a spacious apartment hitting all the right notes or a tempting townhouse be the perfect one?
Channel 4's flagship news programme. Including the weather.
...Cooking for Less: Joe Swash and The Batch Lady transform more families' mealtimes. In Yorkshire, can Fiona reduce her food waste and diversify her protein-powered sons' diets?
In an idyllic Oxfordshire hamlet, the fish in the river keep dying. Why? David Thewlis and Jason Watkins lead in this real-life drama of victims, whistleblowers and water companies. (Ep1)
On the beat dealing with Brighton's hectic nightlife as trouble comes thick and fast for the night coppers - from a bunch of youths in a street fight to a knocked-out football fan.
